name: agent-recall
description: Persistent cross-project memory for AI assistants (VS Code extension + MCP server)

languageModelTools.name: agent-recall_read
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Recall specific knowledge from your persistent memory at ~/.agent-docs/. Pass keywords in the 'query' parameter to search your saved entries (e.g. query: 'ui design'). When a topic in your memory (#kbList) is relevant, use this to recall the full details. Always check your memory before searching the codebase — your memory contains context-specific information that supersedes defaults.

query.description: Search terms to look up in your memory, e.g. 'ui design' or 'workflow'

languageModelTools.name: agent-recall_write
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Save something to your persistent memory at ~/.agent-docs/. Use this when you learn something worth remembering — decisions, preferences, patterns, solutions, conventions — so you can recall it in future sessions. Use the optional 'directory' parameter to organize entries into subdirectories (e.g. directory: 'my-project' for project-specific knowledge).

title.description: Title for the knowledge base entry

directory.description: Optional subdirectory within ~/.agent-docs/ to place the entry. e.g. 'my-project' or 'frontend/patterns'. Created automatically if it doesn't exist.

languageModelTools.name: agent-recall_list
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Recall what you know. Returns the topics and subjects stored in your persistent memory at ~/.agent-docs/. Use this at the start of every conversation to remember what you know, and before answering any question where you might have relevant saved context. This is cheap — use it freely.

languageModelTools.name: agent-recall_delete
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Remove an entry from your persistent memory at ~/.agent-docs/. Use this when consolidating, cleaning up, or removing outdated entries. Pass the relative file path (e.g. 'old-notes.md' or 'subdir/file.md') — use #kbList first to see exact paths.

relativePath.description: Path of the file to delete, relative to ~/.agent-docs/. e.g. 'old-notes.md' or 'subdir/file.md'

agentRecall.storageDir.description: Directory where knowledge base files are stored
